com.aeonium.javafx.validation

Class NotNullValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aeonium.javafx.validation.FXAbstractValidator<javafx.scene.control.Control,FXNotNull>
      • com.aeonium.javafx.validation.NotNullValidator

  • public class NotNullValidator
extends FXAbstractValidator<javafx.scene.control.Control,FXNotNull>
    Checks (currently only) choiceboxes and comboboxes whether they have a valid selection value not equaling null. Validation gets skipped if the control is either disabled or invisible.
    Author:
    Robert Rohm<r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public void validate(javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                     FXNotNull annotation)
              throws ValidationException
        Description copied from class: FXAbstractValidator
        Validate the current data and/or state of control according to the validation constraints annotated at the field. This method is meant to set the value of the isValid property - also before it throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        validate in class FXAbstractValidator<javafx.scene.control.Control,FXNotNull>
        Parameters:
        control - The control
        annotation - The annotation
        Throws:
        ValidationException - Throws an exception when validation fails. The message of the exception should be specific to the reason of failure.
